Game used to be fairly fun, but now runs between 2-20 FPS, normally hovering around 12-14.  Basically unplayable for a competitive multiplayer game.  Changing graphics settings/resolution makes no difference. It's been like this for a week now, I'm just giving up and uninstalling, glad I didn't spend money on any of the add-ons.

EDIT - As of the 10/19/21 patch, it still hovers in low-teen FPS

Ã“timo jogo slc, recomendo

This game offers a very unique asymmetrical play style that compels players to think quickly and make on-the-spot decisions that directly affect whether the players win or lose; it's a delightful whirlwind of adrenaline that differs with each 15 minute game where a variety of different power-ups and special abilities guarantees a unique gameplay experience with each match! However, a lack of developer response player feedback, balancing issues, in-game glitches, and in-game repercussions for griefers does make the game unenjoyable from time to time. Still, would recommend!

I would not currently recommend getting into this game and grinding out the teachable perks for characters at the moment as the matchmaking is not rewarding after their most recent update to the MMR system. Your MMR is a hidden variable determining how you match make against people, and honestly I'm not having fun on either Killer or Survivor right now. When I play survivor, every killer is slugging or tunneling or camping and is using the best perks and add-ons almost every single game. When I play killer I'm against 4 man SWF stacks basically every game, half of the time live on twitch. I acknowledge that this means I'm in the "higher bracket" of the system, but I'm not really having fun anymore. Every killer game is a sweatfest as you deal with the same 8 meta perks in the game since 2016, along with a few new additions as the survivors have total control over the state of the game on most maps and with most killers, with no real chance to ever win without implementing unfun tactics as previously mentioned to get the odds in your favor early on. Every survivor game (solo) ends in 5 minutes one way or the other because the killer gets dumpstered by genrushing or my team gets demolished by an overpowered add on/ the previously mentioned tactics. If you're casual and lose about as much as you win you may enjoy the game more, but at this point the devs are forcing any veterans of the game to always face off in these "competitive matches" no one really asked for. Part of the charm of the game before was facing different killers/survivors of different skill levels on a game to game basis that let you play in fun ways and use non-meta builds.

Update: The latest update is a big change and atleast makes it not one of the worst games ever made. The balance is much better, with killer being stronger and it's much more enjoyable. And it's no longer grindier then an JRPG. However, below still applies. You still get hackers, and most of them are only subtle cheating, so you won't even realise. You'll just lose games horribly and assume it's because you're bad.

Way too many hackers. Literally can't play 5 games without a hacker. Doesn't matter if you play Killer or Survivor. You will have to play against hackers every time you log on. It's not a bad game otherwise, (super unbalanced, you will literally never have a fair match in this game, no matter how many hours you play) but hackers completely ruin it. Don't buy this game, even on sale. It's borderline unplayable in it's current state.
